item.title: Refactoring
item.description: Jeff Bezos characterised decisions as “two-way” or “one-way” doors. A two way door means you can reverse a decision, but a one way door is difficult or expensive to reverse. Framing things in this way is freeing because you can allow yourself to experiment knowing things can be undone. Detailed planning is just not required for easily reversable decisions. Something I’ve grown to realise is that in my workplace some of these experimental decisions have the people around me feeling like they’re irreversable.
